I'm going out of my mind!

You can not save me from the rain of fire
Oh son! Sad he: I could talk with you
Questions haunt me
What will be left of my existence
The glory and eternity
The prolongation of pain and decay

Anger and patience, dreams of my desires
Darkness is falling, I'll see the light no more
Eternal perdition, souls of desperation
Forgiveness and sorrow, never-ending hellhole of regret!

In silence, I will find my control
The silence, brings me back into my world
I feel into despair, tell you of my anguish and my pain
I crossed the other side, my flesh is burning
I'm going out of my mind!
Lost in my despair

The silence, follow me into my world
In silence! The eyes of torment and mourn
I feel into despair, tell you of my anguish and my pain
I crossed the other side, my flesh is burning
I'm going out of my mind!
Lost my despair, I'm suffering into the eternal flames

‚ô∞ ‚ô∞ ‚ô∞

No Hope of Death

Through the gates of pain
Land of the wasted souls
Point of no return, stench of misery
Condemned to eternity
Leave any hope of death
Waiting for every man who fears no God

Voice of desperation
Inglorious existence
Screams of endless hate, tears of suffering
Legions of souls
Sinners with no remorse
They are forever lost in that black air of death

No forgiveness, no salvation for them
Resignation and pain
They have no hope of death
No hope for death

Visions of castigation
Malicious sounds of Hell
Accents of terror, words of blasphemy
Lost into eternal storm
Betrayers of the past
Eternal ways of pain, out of reality

No forgiveness, no salvation for them
Resignation and pain
They have no hope of death
No hope for death

‚ô∞ ‚ô∞ ‚ô∞

The Great Refusal (Ignavus)

"Only etterne, and I eternal last!"
"through me the ways among the people lost"
Hard to understand, show me who they are!
Words of agony resounded
through the air without a star

Slaves of themselves, martyrs of the lies
Revelations, believers in disguise
Through this way we go, to the city dolent!
Holy sentence of the great refusal, he has no repent!

Hear the voice of souls into fetid plains of insanity
Evil eyes of perverse ecstasy

And voices high and hoarse, with sound of hands
Ululations of despair across the lands
Reign of sadness, no infamy or praise
Horrid confusion, abandoned in disgrace
Rage and madness, here there's no innocent
Sacred torment of the great refusal, they have no repent!

Spells of imprecation, lost in squalid delight
Disgusting bedlam who were never alive
Miscreants and depraved of the futile identities
God's unwelcome and his enemies
...And his enemies

"Through me the way is to eternal dole"
Commingled with that unholy choir of the angel's fall
Expelled from the heavens, nor them the abyss receisves
For glory none the damned would have from them

Divine justice, languages of hate
Disdained and envious of every other fate
Through this way we go, to the city dolent!
Holy sentence of the great refusal, he has no repent!
No repent! No repent! No repent!

‚ô∞ ‚ô∞ ‚ô∞

***Íú± ú·¥è·¥ú ü·¥Ö ·¥Ñ·¥è·¥ò è Ä…™…¢ ú·¥õ  ú·¥è ü·¥Ö·¥á Ä …¥·¥è·¥õ ·¥°·¥Ä…¥·¥õ Íú∞·¥Ä…¥ ·¥ò Ä·¥è·¥ç·¥è·¥õ…™·¥è…¥, ·¥ò ü·¥á·¥ÄÍú±·¥á ·¥Ö Ä·¥è·¥ò ·¥Ä  ü…™…¥·¥á ·¥Ä…¥·¥Ö ·¥ç·¥Ä·¥õ·¥á Ä…™·¥Ä ü Íú± ú·¥Ä ü ü  ô·¥á ·¥Ö·¥á ü·¥á·¥õ·¥á·¥Ö. ·¥õ ú…™Íú± …™Íú± ·¥Ä …¥·¥è…¥-·¥ç·¥è…¥·¥á·¥õ…™·¥¢·¥á·¥Ö ·¥Ñ ú·¥Ä…¥…¥·¥á ü Íú±·¥è …™'·¥ç …¥·¥è·¥õ ·¥ç·¥Ä·¥ã…™…¥…¢ ·¥ç·¥è…¥·¥á è Íú∞ Ä·¥è·¥ç ·¥ú·¥ò ü·¥è·¥Ä·¥Ö·¥á·¥Ö ·¥ç·¥Ä·¥õ·¥á Ä…™·¥Ä üÍú±. ·¥õ ú·¥Ä…¥·¥ãÍú±**

Title: In Aevum Agere: The Shadow Tower
Description:
The Shadow Tower 2012
Doom Metal (Italy)
https://inaevumagere.bandcamp.com/album/the-shadow-tower-2

I. Umbra Vitae - Intro 00:00
II. The Shadow Tower 00:48
III. Leave Me Alone (Sinite Me Solum) 05:17
IV. Iniquitous Judgement 10:40
V. The Last Farewell 16:19
VI. Act of Faith 21:45
VII. Dominio 26:24
VIII. Silent 32:58
IX. Il Poema Illusorio 36:40
X. Ire of Solitude (Bonus Track) 42:58
XI. Son of Unknown (Bonus Track) 48:16

‚Ä† ‚Ä† ‚Ä† 

The Shadow Tower

In my darkest torment
tears of blood are falling in solitude
Anything is silence
and my pain is stronger than fear
I believe in nothing
and my eyes watch no more
Imprisoned in a shadow tower
my agony has just begun

I‚Äôm a ghost, I‚Äôm a dying presence
and my voice is strong no more
Into a noiseless sign of existence
my memories don‚Äôt want die

Time has gone so fast and I live the past
my life has passed away
Into ethereal trials of my reality
I breathe my pain

I cannot hear
I don‚Äôt want hear
what is the truth I need to know?

Veils of sadness
cover my loneliness
I swear, I‚Äôll close my heart
I‚Äôll not reveal my pain no more

My life of darkness
My tears of nothingness
my broken heart, my skin so cold

I don‚Äôt want hear
I have no fear
nobody knows my pain and I‚Äôll not reveal it no more

I close my life

‚Ä† ‚Ä† ‚Ä† 

Iniquitous Judgement

Eyes all around, voices from the unknown
Into darkness that's calling your name
You're turning back for despair, nothing to see
Quick is your breath, raises silent fear
You think cannot save you from your fate
Finders of soul wait for you, they judge for your sins

Thousand of words, thousand of thoughts
Explanations away from the pain
You try to react but your mind and your hands are unchained
You are alone, you are out of control
Deep inside you, a deafening silence
Accused for your vain existence, you are guilty to exist

Eyes of fate - endless time of pain
Eyes of clemency - lies in pain

Falling illusion, dark side of fate
Like a dreamless mind, there is no way
Hopeless eyes to your uncertain doom
Wait for ending of this inhuman torment
Your existence, your silent wait
All your authentic reasons descent
Hate inventors indict your soul
You know that is their iniquitous judgement

Eyes all around, voices from the unknown
Into darkness that's calling your name
You are turning back for despair, nothing you see
You are alone, you are out of control
Deep inside you, loud screaming of pain
You are judged and condemned to eternity

Eyes of fate - endless time of pain
Eyes of clemency - lies in pain

Title: In Aevum Agere: From the Depth of Soul
Description:
From the Depth of Soul 2007
Doom Metal (Naples, Italy)
https://inaevumagere.bandcamp.com/album/from-the-depth-of-soul

I. Omne Aevum (Intro) 00:00
II. In Aevum Agere 01:05
III. From the Depth of Soul 06:23
IV. Ex - Animo (Interludium) 11:40
V. My Eyes of Pain 12:23
VI. Vocatio Mistica (Voice of Mind) 16:59

‚Ä† ‚Ä† ‚Ä† 

Rest in pain, without your faith
Your eyes are staring the emptiness
Eternal sleep, into depth of silence
Did you have a chance to seize the day?

Your hurts that bleed
And your hands are scared and cold
Your cry towards the nothingness
On my knees your face of sorrow
Time has gone don‚Äôt look back again

Wasted is the time to absolve your soul
Ashes to ashes, damnation! (Resignation!)
Fall into darkness expiate for your faults
Death is reality you‚Äôve got it you know to exist
Lost is your reality forsake to eternal life*

No one answer
No one hope for human sin
It surrounds you ‚Ä¶

... Deserted in a world of pain (you cannot see the end)
Surrounds you
Eternal life is not in your destiny

‚Ä† ‚Ä† ‚Ä† 

I close my eyes and I feel my sadness
So I really can to see
Where‚Äôre the things I‚Äôm pretending
I hold the frost of reality

A breath, my thoughts in contemplation
Scars and not healing hurts
Human faults, human creations
I make my world of dreams apart

All my of dreams of early life live again they‚Äôll never die
As sweet touch of harmony
From the depth I hear a call it‚Äôs the voice of my soul
It‚Äôs a beautiful melody

I‚Äôm alive and I‚Äôve got my mind control
I give my answers
True is my pain, my anxiety, my existence
I write my fate following my soul
Please forgive me I don‚Äôt see the end
Of that is not, it will be then

Trap of existence

My life is just begun I‚Äôll forgive the suffered evil
I will pleased to give my real well
for a dying soul
Shall be done for me? Silent hope to tomorrow?
After the end I‚Äôll know
Meaning of the death, from the depth of soul

Closed my eyes refuge of madness
To find the real mean to be
Image to mirrors of uniqueness
I discover in me my identity

Raging words of resignation
So I‚Äôm still in solitude
Human fault of isolation
I leave myself free to choose

Title: Castlevania - Bloody Tears (Stylophone cover)
Description:
If you want to give me a "Double Like", you can support me on Ko-fi:
https://ko-fi.com/maromaro1337

I love this song! Bloody Tears is my favorite Castlevania tune, with maybe Vampire Killer being second. Such a shame that it had to be presented in such a bad game. But still, the theme holds up to this day. You can even play with the chord progression and record an epic solo on it!

PS. It's Halloween!

My Socials:
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/maromaro1337
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/marrogitarro

#BloodyTears #Castlevania #Stylophone

Title: Tetris Theme "Korobeiniki" (Stylophone cover)
Description:
You can give me a "double like" on Ko-Fi!
https://ko-fi.com/maromaro1337

This is actually the A-Type music from the original Tetris (there are 3 songs - A,B,C). In reality it's a traditional Russian song called "Korobeiniki".
I did this one in the short and forgot to make a full video! So here it is! The game that's playing in the back is my take. I played the Gameboy original version. I'm not that good in Tetris, but this one was pretty neat.

My Socials:
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/maromaro1337
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/marrogitarro

#Tetris #Korobeiniki #Stylophone

Title: Iron Maiden - Fear Of The Dark (Stylophone cover)
Description:
You can support me on Ko-fi
https://ko-fi.com/maromaro1337

Sorry it took so long but this track is over 7 minutes long! It was a blast making it, but damn - 4 minutes would be enough... But as you know, the cover must be perfect so yeah! Here's the whole song! The funny thing is that it wasn't even that hard. The Dual Stylophone main riff was a bit hard (the double tap one) and the bass part was pretty tight. Steve Harris is a beast!

My Socials:
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/maromaro1337
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/marrogitarro

#IronMaiden #FearOfTheDark #Stylophone

Title: Black Sabbath - Iron Man (Stylophone cover w/ solos)
Description:
You can support me on Ko-fi
https://ko-fi.com/maromaro1337

This one took longer then expected, because:
1) This song is almost 6 minutes long!
2) Every 4-8 bars there is a tempo change
3) The solos are horrible to play on the Stylophone
So sorry for the wait, but as you can see it was not easy. Aside from that I still had some fun while doing it!

My Socials:
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/maromaro1337
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/marrogitarro

Technicals

Solo - Stylophone S1 tuned to H

2nd Solo Add guitar - tuned to D

Riff - 2 Stylophones S1 played simultaneously 
tuning: left H, right E

Bass - Stylophone S1 tuned to E + 2 Stylophones S1 tuned to H and E

Vocals - Stylophone S1 tuned to E

Drums - 2 Stylophones Beatbox

#BlackSabbath #IronMan #Stylophone

Title: Orchestral French Funk with Kit Sebastian
Description:
All music rights belong to their rightful owners. Please support the musicians and buy their music.
#vinylmix #french #60s

Kit Sebastian is a duo formed in London by Kit Martin and Merve Erdem, spread between Turkey and France. Their music is a meeting point of different genres from Anatolian Psychedelia and Brazilian Tropicalia to 60‚Äôs European pop and American jazz. Following their debut album 'Mantra Moderne' and two 7" releases, they released their second album 'Melodi' this autumn that's considered as a joyous merging of soundscapes, evoking a borderless planet with music as an international language. The duo also produces and directs their own music videos.

These tracks cover the period between the mid-60s to mid-70s in France when arrangers were exploring sophisticated and abstract arrangements within pop music.

Title: Nytt Land - Ritual (Full Album 2021)
Description:
Ritual (2021)
https://nyttland.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/nyttland/
The magic of the Ancient North.
Music, skillfully balancing on the brink of ritual ambient and the traditional folk of Northern Europe, is born in the heart of Siberia. The instruments created by the musicians of the band awaken something sacred, long forgotten. And the beats of the drums, amplified by throat singing, lead the Siberian shamans' path far through the vast taiga. 
Nytt Land
Kalachinsk, Russia
====
1.
Ritual 00:00
2.
The Fires of Ragnarok     07:10
3.
The Birth of a Shaman    12:32
4.
Dead Man‚Äôs Dance  18:26
5.
U-Gra   23:35
6.
Gr√≥ttas√∂ngr     29:35
7.
Svartravn    36:54
8.
Blood of the North   42:38
====
"Emerging from the frostbitten, dark and brooding woods of Siberia, NYTT LAND ascends as one of the most captivating and haunting musical forces in folk music. On their new album, Ritual, out August 6 via Napalm Records, NYTT LAND effortlessly pulls listeners into a world of ancient percussive instrumentation and vocal tradition: eight songs on Ritual tell tales of gods and heroes, born centuries ago and preserved in traditions, expressed in a unique sonic experience that can best be described by the duo iself as Shamanic Dark Folk.

NYTT LAND‚Äôs ancient shamanic culture is palpable on songs like ‚ÄúU-Gra‚Äù ‚Äì based on the legend of the Siberian native tribe known as Khanty. It tells the story of the guardian spirits of the tribe‚Äôs homeland as somber ritual chants at the start of the song ask the spirits to be kind to their people and help them retain their lands. An atmospheric, meditative journey accompanied by an enthralling percussive section accents the unmatched, unique throat singing vocal layers of NYTT LAND. ‚ÄúSvartravn‚Äù seamlessly continues this vibe while introducing melancholic string sections, telling the story of a warrior dying on the battlefield with a crow circling him, awaiting his coup de grace. The dying warrior tells the crow about his worthy life and the deeds that he performed, and that he is not afraid of death, asking the raven to take the news of his death to his family. Underlying themes on Ritual become apparent in NYTT LAND‚Äôs artistic entity, pulled together by mysterious, haunting visuals while still welcoming the listener into their spiritual world. Songs like ‚ÄúDead Man‚Äôs Dance‚Äù and ‚ÄúBlood Of The North‚Äù showcase the Nordic folk-driven roots of NYTT LAND, while the shamanic duo takes the genre to new levels on ‚ÄúThe Fires of Ragnarok‚Äù and title track ‚ÄúRitual‚Äù. Ritual is a previously uncharted display of intense, dark folk music inspired by NYTT LAND‚Äôs unique, authentic and ancient Siberian culture. If bands like WARDRUNA, HEILUNG or RUNAHILD ensnare your senses, then you must prepare for this Ritual!" 
====
released August 6, 2021

Title: Hands of Orlac: Vengeance From The Grave EP
Description:
Vengeance From The Grave 2010 
Doom Metal (Malm√∂, Sweden)
Curse of the Human Skull: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WRPqKA4pWd8

I. Vengeance from the Grave 00:00
II. Woland's Omen 06:47
III. Blood of the Dead 13:17
IV. Sorceress (Angel Witch cover) 20:58

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Vengeance from the Grave

Nobody at the village
Ever understood my misery
Disgust and repulsion
Is what I received from Bernan
Nobody at the village
Is aware of the secret I keep
Now on through the ages
Who'll laugh at Murdo anymore

Hidden by bare trees a castle has been standing
Where they carried out unholy rites for their evil will
Sacrificing and tormenting mercilessly
Under their aegis the village was held

People rose against them
Iron and fire over the Templars fortress
Burn both of their eyes
They will not find the path to come back as they swine

As sworn tonight they will come back
I'll be their eyes to lead them where
They'll soothe their blood thirst from your sons
Will you repent before you're dead!

Let them have their vengeance from the grave, no
Useless to hide, they'll hear you. No way to
Escape death, they will banquet with your hearts
You will die pierced by their unholy swords

Tonight at the village
They will come back from the grave
Trough fires and laughter
I'm not alone, I'm with them
To reach for the village
All that they need is my lead
It will be a beautiful feast

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Blood of the Dead

In a boundless and spectral field
Some old ruins are telling me
About furious deeds of invaders
It smells of cruelty and genocide.
He trudges hardly out of the light
Broken bones harrow the flesh.
He seems to hear and advice in their wind
And then he drinks the Blood of the Dead

Hold on, despite the dark in your mind
Hold on, the sickle won't wait your time
Hold on, despite the black in your eyes
Hold on

A baleful swarming impious desecration
An evil seeding takes him a new life
His eyes are haunted with ruby damnation
One draught and you can't refrain from the blood
He trudges hardly towards the darkness
Blinding, wrathful, that thirst never ceases
Lust for flesh, he can feel the death living
He sinks in league with dark forces

Now I clearly see which side I stand

But when the beast wakes up, the hunger must be
satisfied
And when the darkness descends you'll pray and beg
for your pain and your grief
But after all you'll hear the call of the one who redraft
all his creatures

Abate your rage, eternity is long
The human race will feed you with blood
Don't be afraid about what will be
Believe in me...

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Satan's Wizards, what a name!!!
It could be the title of a horror movie from the 70s. Much like the intro of this eponymous track is freely based on the Tombs of the Blind Dead's soundtrack.
How can we discribe our Doom? It's like a vertigo in the pit!
Satan's Wizards
Nantes, France
====
lyrics
SATAN‚Äô S WIZARDS

We are legion in the whole world
We do the job for Satan to clean up this earth of lies
Perpetrate by the wickeds of mankind.

I promise to everyone, that anything will be not like before our coming.

Then, prepare to change.
We are the future, the fate, the split like a vertigo in the pit

Heavy clouds darken the sky
Hurry up! Make a choice
Don‚Äô t stay still and move, join us and increase the rows.

Listen my word, come and see.
Sharpen your sword and follow me.
You understand, you have the faculty to liberate yourself and to feed your fury.

Be strong in your mind and you try to survive.
In the end of the fight, your spirit shall be rise.

Let be a satan‚Äôs wizard
You can see the light.

Description:
Land of Mystery 1985 City Record/Shadow Kingdom Records
Veneto, Italy
https://shadowkingdomrecords.bandcamp.com/album/land-of-mystery

I. Demoniac City 00:00
II. Land of Mystery 06:10
III. All My Evil 13:16
IV. Bells of Death 19:30
V. Blind Men and Occult Forces 25:50
VI. Spectral World 33:55
VII. Obscurity in the Ethereal House 41:54
VIII. Overture (demo 1985) 49:57
IX. Angel of Lucifer (demo 1985) 50:33
X. Crying Puppets (demo 1985) 57:51
XI. End of All Times (demo 1985) 1:02:30

"Italy gave birth to the genres of Horror Movies and Horror Metal. If BLACK SABBATH and GOBLIN gave birth to a band, this band would be it. This is a very raw/flawed recording, very atmospheric with its 70's style synthesizer, haunting vocals (sung in English, but with a heavy Italian accent), and hypnotic riffs. It's off beat in nature, but if you want dark, as darker than the word black, this recording is not to be missed. "Land Of Mystery" was ahead of its time and the holy grail of the Italian Doom Metal scene. This is the cream of the crop and if you're into Heavy Metal and Doom Metal, it would be sacrilegious to not own this album."

Title: The Wandering Midget: Temples in the Sky
Description:
From the Meadows of Opium Dreams 2012
Eyes Like Snow Records/Finnish Doom Metal
From The Meadows Of Opium Dreams full-length: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NJioxRX5STo

I. The Burning Desert

As I walk alone in the land of sand and heat
Listening to the winds singing hexes in my ears
The moon reveals the paths marked by an unknown race
Wanderers from behind the stars who came here before men

I can hear the desert cry, it's dark when the moon does hide
And I am trapped behind the wall of time

As the sunrise kills the night their temples fill the sky
As another day goes by I know this is where I'll die
In my dreams a black-clad witch guides me on my way
But every time I reach for her she says that she cannot stay

I can hear the call of gods, they want me by their side
But are their temples just within my mind?

II. The Witch

Oh, don't leave me
Empress of the night
I won't deceive thee
And I long to reach your shrines up in the sky

Temples in the sky
Light shines in her eyes
Chaos of her mind crawling deep inside

Face down to the ground... don't you make a sound
Hear their awful cry
This is where you die...

III. The Meadows of Opium Dreams

In dreams I went to find her at the meadows of opium dreams
Where nameless things go play their games
under the purple moon
I walked across the desert, she walked ahead of me
Stopped and looked into my eyes
I saw my destiny

No, I cannot reach their temples
and if you find me...

She laid there right beside me and took me deep within
Moonbeams dancing on her skin
As pale as a dead can be
Her eyes were full of hatred as she whispered in my ear...
"In the temples in the sky they wait
and they want both you and me!"

No I cannot reach their temples
and if you find me

Just walk your way

‚ò©   ‚ò©   ‚ò©

====
Forbidden Place Records announces March 3rd release date for The Eye of the Icosahedron, the new double album by Dungeon Weed!

DUNGEON WEED‚Äôs first album, Mind Palace of the Mushroom God, was conjured in the early days of pandemic lockdown as a collaboration between multi-instrumentalist Dmitri Mavra (Skunk, Slow Phase) and Chris McGrew, studio engineer/session drummer at San Francisco‚Äôs Wally‚Äôs Hyde Out, along with singer Thia Moonbrook. A concept album in which a sorcerer bargains for immortality with Orcus, God of the Underworld, and makes a deal that goes horribly wrong, Mind Palace of the Mushroom God was an instant hit with its eye-blasting artwork and heavy ‚Äúwizard sludge‚Äù riffs. The band was signed to Forbidden Place Records within days and the first vinyl pressing sold out soon after.

Now, the story comes to an epic conclusion in the new double album as the sorcerer seeks the mystical gem that will free him from the curse of Orcus.
McGrew, Moonbrook, and Mavra are joined by synth lord Rama to weave this eldritch tale of dark, mind-bending magic. Hypnotic riffs flow seamlessly into dreamlike interludes, transporting the listener through the many shifting moods of this psychedelic doom epic. Dungeon Weed‚Äôs ‚Äúwizard sludge‚Äù is unique a heavy doom sound that touches on stoner rock, black metal, dungeon synth, prog, and more.
====

released March 3, 2022

Dmitri Mavra - guitar, bass, vocals, synthesizer
Chris McGrew - drums
Thia Moonbrook - vocals
Rama - synthesizer, sounds

Music, lyrics, recording, mixing, art by Dmitri Mavra
Drums Recorded by Chris McGrew & Liam Craddock (Wally‚Äôs Hyde Out)
Mastered by Justin Weiss (Trakworx)
Fuzzy Mind Records (FMR010)
Forbidden Place Records (FPR171)
¬©2022 Dmitri Mavra
FPR171

Title: Zelda: A Link to the Past - Hyrule Castle Acapella
Description:
Here's my a-cappella arrangement of Hyrule Castle from The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past!

Support my videos on Patreon! ‚ñ∫ http://www.patreon.com/SmoothMcGroove

One of the most iconic themes from one of my absolute favorite games of all time, I've put off recording this song for years! So glad to finally dig into this song, and the challenges that came with it. Without much percussion, I noticed this arrangement didn't hit as hard as the original, so I got creative and put my own percussion in. The goal was the make it sound just like the original and not get in the way. It's crazy how many of my favorite songs Koji Kondo composed... Hope you guys enjoy :)

Title: Stone Axe - Stay of Execution (Full Album 2022)
Description:
Port Orchard's soulful 70s rockers STONE AXE make a triumphant return with their first release in over a decade. "Stay of Execution" is a collection of unreleased tracks and hidden gems, about which Stone Axe founder and multi-instrumentalist Tony Reed says: ‚ÄúStay of Execution is an album of unreleased recordings and tracks we like that were hidden in the grooves of vinyl that was released in very limited numbers with little or no promotion. All songs were recorded between 2008 and 2011 and cover a wide spectrum of styles in that seventies vein we were known for. The musical concepts of proto-metal, southern rock, psychedelic rock, and folk rock are well-explored in this collection. Seven of the eight tracks on the album feature the usual studio collaboration of Reed / Brinkerhoff, while the last song includes all four members of the live band. I feel like these tracks are as strong as anything on our other long players. It‚Äôs great to see them finally get released.‚Äù=

Title: Doomed & Stoned: The Instrumentalists (Vol. III) | Full Album Compilation 2021
Description:
Buy Digital Album / name your price: https://doomedandstoned.bandcamp.com/album/doomed-stoned-the-instrumentalists-vol-iii
INTRODUCTION:''For the past several years, we've been noticing a significant upswing in the number of instrumental bands making their presence known on Bandcamp and elsewhere. That is, rock and metal collaborations that have opted to do without a singer. At first, I admit greeting such projects with a squint eye, but my skepticism quickly dissipated once I heard what they were capable of doing musically and artistically.

Thus far in our four-volume series, we've borne witness to a bountiful array of heavy music-making talent who have turned the medium into practically its own form of art.

Before us lay an eclectic collection of bands, several of whom have been significant game-changers in the sub-genre like Clouds Taste Satanic with their "character pieces" (in this case taking a page out of The Book of Revelation and animating it stunningly to life). The Brooklyn band's prowess for creating visual tone poems is nothing short of stunning. They are at the forefront of creativity and innovation in this burgeoning genre.

Another example is one-man band Hellvetika, brainchild of incredible musical mind Aaron D.C. Edge (who has been involved in too many bands to count). Here he doesn't simply cover Kyuss, he transforms it into a sludgey beast that gives you a good idea of what's in store for you when you dive into his voluminous catalogue.

Still others, such as "endless jam band" B√∂se from Poland, completely improvise every single composition they commit to record, applying something of a jazz ethos towards psychedelic doom. To say they are prolific is an understatement once you see the discography they've amassed in only a couple of years.

Once again, huge gratitude is due to Rob Hammer for helping me to organize this rather intimidating project (and to his mum for the stellar album art!), which has had us racking our brains and scouring the globe to find bands we think you'll not only enjoy, but appreciate.

With that said, it has been my joy to personally curate the arrangement before you in Doomed & Stoned: The Instrumentalists (Vol. III).

Give ear...''

Billy Goat
Editor in Chief
DOOMED & STONED
http://www.doomedandstoned.com/

'Bringing you the music and the stories of the heavy underground, the world 'round. By the underground, for the underground, from the unholy year of 2013.' 
====
Special thanks to Rob Hammer's mum, who once again supplied us with her artwork for this ambitious new series!

Check out Rob Hammer's work:

YouTube channel:
https://youtube.com/c/ROBHAMMERstonerdoompsychsludgegrungemetal
-
Facebook group;
https://facebook.com/groups/jpriest011
====
Doomed and Stoned Records
Sharing the music and the stories of the heavy underground since 2013, Doomed & Stoned seeks to document the explosion in doom metal and stoner rock, two styles that have grown up together since the 1970s and exist today in incredible stylistic variation and artistic excellence.

Title: Tenebra - Moongazer (Full Album 2022)
Description:
UK, Eur and ROTW: https://tenebra666.bandcamp.com/album/moongazer
North and South America from Seeing Red Records: http://shop.seeingredrecords.com
https://lnk.to/TenebraMoongazeralbum
https://www.facebook.com/thetruetenebra/
https://www.instagram.com/tenebraband/
TENEBRA are a four piece band formed in Bologna.
====
1.
Heavy Crusher 00:00
2.
Cracked Path     03:06
3.
Black Lace    07:37
4.
Carry My Load    12:30
5.
Winds Of Change   17:15
6.
Stranded  21:48
7.
Space Child   25:37
8.
Dark And Distant Sky   30:58
9.
Moon Maiden   35:33
====
New Heavy Sounds is very proud to bring you Moongazer, the second album by the four-piece heavy stoner rock powerhouse from Italy, TENEBRA.
Moongazer contains nine slabs of crushing fuzzed up grooves, fuelled by 70‚Äôs proto metal, hard rock and psych-blues, loaded with great riffs and melody and topped off by gutsy soulful vocals.
Musically, you could say that TENEBRA occupy similar musical terrain to bands such as Graveyard, Witchcraft, Kadaver and other bands of that ilk, but TENEBRA are very much their own beast. They have all the chops of course, but are musically less slavish, often adding a twist that keeps the songs fresh and now. There‚Äôs also very little reliance on Sabbath-isms (apart from one cheeky nod) and though occult rock is also part of the vibe, the music steers well clear of the cliches. In fact the band bring a clutch of left field influences into their melting pot as well, from June of 44 and Love Battery to the Misfits and the psych grunge of Screaming Trees, much of it in evidence on this new album. In fact Gary Lee Conner of Screaming Trees actually contributes to 'Moon Maiden'.
Of the four members, Claudio (bass), Emilio (guitar) and Mesca (drums) came from the hardcore and post-hardcore squat scene that gathered around Bologna, whereas their formidable vocalist Silvia (the youngest of the crew) is immersed in the underground rock of the '60s and' 70s. When you hear her sing you‚Äôll know where she‚Äôs coming from as she has one helluva rock voice, laced with whiskey, smoke, grit, late nights and a whole lotta soul. Think Maggie Bell meets Betty Davis with a smattering of Gillan, and you'll be in the right ballpark.
What you get with ‚ÄòMoongazer‚Äô is a band revelling in the spirit of 70‚Äôs rock rather than recreating it, and it's a thrilling ride. 
====
released April 29, 2022

Produced by Tenebra and Bruno Germano
Recorded by Emilio Torreggiani and Bruno Germano at PS1 Studio and The Shack Studio
Mixed by Bruno Germano at Vacuum Studio
Additional vocals on "Winds Of Change" by Riccardo "Frabbo" Frabetti
Saxophone on "Space Child" by Giorgio Trombino
Slide guitar and Mellotron on "Dark and Distant Sky" by Bruno Germano
Lead guitar on "Moon Maiden" by Gary Lee Conner
Cover Art by Marcello Crescenzi - riseabove.it
Cover Layout by Claudio "Mesca" Collina

Title: Zen Gangster Ballad Breaks & Beats: Lofi Hip Hop Compilation Vol. 1
Description:
Flipping beautiful but forgotten melodies from the past and fusing them with hard, heavy-hitting b-boy breaks of fury.

Volume 1 marks a shift - from coping to crafting. The pain is still there, but now it‚Äôs sharpened, channeled, and intentional.

This is where the Zen Gangster Ballad takes form: emotionally charged loops, hardwired drums, and a commitment to finding stillness through sound.

These tracks weren‚Äôt made to impress - they were made to express. To process. To stay human.

Title: Toro y Moi - Causers of This (Instrumentals)
Description:
Buy/Listen: https://found.ee/TYM-Causers-10year

"'Causers of This' is a glimpse into my early life as a suburban, American, POC. It is a reaction to what it feels like to lose. Ironically, all of the sessions and files making up the album were lost in a car burglary in 2009; all that was left were the instrumentals. The lyrics were the last element added on this particular record and I'm excited for my listeners to experience the album the way I first intended it to be. Now, 10 years later, it feels more appropriate than ever to release this pared-down version of the record to leave space for thought and reflection. Thank you all for being a part of this journey with me.

50% of the Bandcamp proceeds from the Causers instrumentals today (6/27) will go to People's Breakfast Oakland.

Cassette tape out on 7/6/20 exclusively at https://store.toroymoi.com" - Chaz Bear

Animation by FISK

Title: Toro y Moi: NPR Music Tiny Desk Concert
Description:
April 29, 2019 | Bobby Carter -- Chaz Bear, who performs as Toro y Moi, is going to do what he feels. In preparation for his Tiny Desk concert, we were given two possible sound scenarios: aim to recreate the heavily electronic and lustrous aura that birthed his latest LP, Outer Peace or strip away the bells and whistles for an acoustic performance. The game-time decision was the latter and fans were treated to brand new iterations of these songs.

Toro y Moi's discography conveys that same unpredictability and showcases his affinity for a wide span of genres. While largely known as an early pioneer of chillwave, Outer Peace is anything but. It's hard-hitting, funky and directly to the point, as is this Tiny Desk concert. Stripping down such heavily produced songs could risk revealing weaknesses. In this case, the rhythms move just the same. Removing the Auto-Tune, synths and effects make way for some insightful songwriting that's often hard to hear in the recorded version.

"Life is only wishing we could load it
Level up, you've got to make a bonus
Mystic staring at his phone for oneness
Silver or black mirror, what's the difference?"

With shaker in tow, Bear sat front and center at a stool to deliver four of my favorites from Outer Peace, including "Ordinary Pleasure," with bongo assistance from Foots of Foot and Coles.

SET LIST
"Laws of the Universe"
"New House"
"Freelance"
"Ordinary Pleasure"

MUSICIANS
Chaz Bear: lead vocal; Andy Woodward: drums; Tony Ferraro: piano; Patrick Jeffords: bass; Foots: bongos, shaker

CREDITS
Producers: Bobby Carter, Morgan Noelle Smith; Creative Director: Bob Boilen; Audio Engineers: Josh Rogosin, James Willetts; Videographers: Morgan Noelle Smith, CJ Riculan, Beck Harlan, Bronson Arcuri; Photo: Claire Harbage/NPR

Title: Saint Vitus: Children of Doom (Remastered)
Description:
Children of Doom 1992 Hellhound Records/Season of Mist
Los Angeles, CA
Christian Linderson "Chritus" (Lord Vicar) on vocals
Support: https://saintvitus.bandcamp.com/album/c-o-d

I. Intro 00:00
II. Children of Doom 01:40
III. Planet of Judgement 07:48
IV. Shadow of a Skeleton 15:27
V. (I Am) The Screaming Banshee 21:22
VI. Plague of Man 25:09
VII. Imagination Man 33:04
VIII. Fear 37:31
IX. Get Away 42:30
X. Bela 49:57
XI. A Timeless Tale 55:51
XII. Hallow's Victim (Exhumed) 58:07
XIII. To Breed a Soldier 1:02:10 (Bonus track)
XIV. The Chameleon 1:08:14 (Bonus track)

CHILDREN OF DOOM

Children of doom
We are your father
And we are like no other
Let me see your hands
Let me hear you scream
Because you are here
And you know what it means...
We are the children of doom
Give us some room

Like an ancient idol
We stand before you
But we are nothing
Nothing more than you
You are the ones
Who keep us alive
We can feel it from you
See it in your eyes
We are the children of doom
Give us some room

We are the secret
Soon to be known
The more we're together
The quicker we grow
We are the end
Of the endless maze
We are the light
In the daily haze
We are the children of doom

PLANET OF JUDGEMENT

Stranded here a thousand light years away from home
Blackened clouds fill their horizons
Storms to come
They cut down their forests with steel jagged blades
And poison their air
Scorning the surface with nuclear waste
Nature cries

We saw them fight their wars again
They never won
So unwise, no surprise
Their own demise
Pain and starvation throughout their nations
Injustice prevails
Falling from grace, destined to die
We wonder why...

"Heed the warning, time is dawning
Come ye faithful, meet thy maker... it's (His) time"

Stood there helpless
Saw their sun set
So relentless
The very last time

What made them wander this trail of sorrow that has to end?
The signs around them, plain and simple
They chose to pretend
Now nothingness is all that remains
A pity and shame
Should have learned to follow the rules
If you decide to play the game

PLAGUE OF MAN

Come and listen to my tale of woe
My final downfall came not long ago
I have got a disease that breeds tears
It's been plaguing man for years and years

Everybody here knows how it feels
When the heartache grows beyond unreal
All you do is think about that girl
Then the madness cracks your eggshell world

Everything around you falls apart
We have lost the race right from the start
Nothing left inside a washed-out brain
Weighted down forever by her chains
It's the plague of man

FEAR

In the dark recesses
of your little mind
I begin to breathe
It's getting near my time
As the bloody rivers
flow through your veins
I am growing stronger
You'll never be the same

If you think I'm nothing
You better think again
Once you get me started
You will never win
You'll feel me inside you
When you're all alone
Common sense will leave
Then you're mine to own

Feel me
I'm part of you
Feel me
I know you do

Now you're sweating ice
You shake everyday
And it gives me pleasure
To watch your world decay
As you split your seams
And your nerves are shot
You cannot face the world
All control is lost

BELA

Do you know me
I think you do
I rise each night
From my tomb
My bone-dry lips
Long for you
I feed on humans
Freshly brewed

My mortuary
Is a gruesome sight
As I play with you
In the dead of night
I'm never caught
And I'm never seen
As I crease the sky
With the blackest wings

The crack of dawn
Sends a chill through me
I know that I must end my feast
Into the dust I must go
Until the next moonbeam glows

HALLOW'S VICTIM

Panic in the air
Awaken to the call
Ghostly apparitions
Making your skin crawl
Incense, tambourines
Sorcerers arise
All you see are pools of blood
And fire in their eyes

Grinning jack-o-lanterns
Lit by candle-light
Cauldrons bubble over-filled
On this night of nights
Leather bat-like wings
Slicing through the air
Leaves your body white with shock
You're wide-eyed and scared

Cross in your hand
Time to take your stand
Your bravery's fading somehow
Garlic 'round your neck
Paranoia's got you wrecked
You jump at every little sound

Boney witches fingers
Are scratching at your face
Skeletons sit beside you
Making your heart race
Cold sweat is running
Running from your brow
You've got a one-way ticket
To six feet underground

Cross in your hand
Time to take your stand
Your bravery's fading somehow
Garlic 'round your neck
Paranoia's got you wrecked
You jump at every little sound

üïà  üïà  üïà

Title: Turkish '60s on vinyl (Beat, Surf & Garage Rock)
Description:
Welcome to the second season of the Coffee Break Sessions! This is the first episode of the new season where I'm playing 7" records only.  The majority of the records in this episode are from the Altin Mikrofon (Golden Microphone) song contest series organized by Hurriyet, a Turkish best-selling newspaper at the time, which would provide opportunities for those who would like to engage in pop music. The prize of the contest was the ability to record the winning song and a performing job at the Oriental Casino where the contest was held. You will find Haramiler, Mavi Isiklar, Selcuk Alagoz, and more in this set.

Title: Da Captain Trips - Maths of the Elements (2022) (Full Album)
Description:
Da Captain Trips - Maths of the Elements (Full Album) Da Captain Trips is an instrumental psychedelic stoner rock band based in the north of Italy. Maths of the Elements is the fourth full length of the band and comes five years after ‚ÄúAdventures in the Upside Down‚Äù. This album is dedicated to Nature, its Elements, and the slow growth of everything. Each track wants to drive the listener to immerse themselves in a slow journey of awareness of the elements of nature. The songs breathe and develop slowly, are more dilated and improvised than ‚ÄúAdventures in the upside-down‚Äù. 

Each Captain album is different from the previous one also thanks to the line-up changes that this time sees Bachis give way to Paolo ‚ÄúApollo‚Äù Negri on keyboards. This allows the band to reach still unexplored territories, abandoning in some cases the song form. Between songs, field recordings by the friend Hi-Fi Panorama were added to help the process and Kabuto also gives his interpretation with the artwork. The central figure represents the shaman/scientist who tries to interpret and analyze the surrounding nature. But, being part of nature itself, it cries because understanding is both touching and disturbing. The design is completed by the four symbols of the elements, air, water, fire, and earth.

1.  Rivers: Water And Earth Stream - 0:00
2.  Deserts: Earth And Air Carve - 6:22
3.  Mountains: Fire And Earth Sculpt - 13:51
4.  Clouds: Water And Fire Shape - 23:08
5.  Oceans: Air And Water Form - 30:48
6.  Skies: Fire And Air Set - 37:21

Title: Da Captain Trips - Adventures in the Upside Down (2018) (Full Album)
Description:
Da Captain Trips - Adventures in the Upside Down (Full Album) Da Captain Trips have always been a band not constrained by one single approach to music making, they incorporate many different styles, genres etc in their output making them always interesting and always worth checking out. 'Adventures In The Upside Down'  is no different - taking in psychedelia, Space Rock, Prog, krautrock and even surf and, all in all, a damn fine listen! 

'The Calm And The Storm' opens the album with a long, drawn out drone and some electronic effects before a lonesome guitar is heard over the drone - it's all very melancholic and sounding distinctly nautical, with a 'twanging' downbeat surfy vibe. The track opens up to become a motoring psych/space rock number with flashes of kosmische electronica under the guitar. 'Manta' has an intro that reminded me of the 'Knightrider' theme - random I know!. However, it immediately transforms into another chuggin' track with more than a hint of krautrock about it...so far, so great. 'Revelation' is something different altogether....the twang heard in the first track returns with vengeance...a trippy, surf vibe is built, like Jan and Dean on acid, broken only by passages of more cosmic electronica and jazzy psych with saxophone courtesy of Lee Relfe from Sendelica. It's a great track that leaves the listener wondering where things are going next.

'Dear Zahdia' has a very retro feel about it, the vibe is very seventies with flashes of prog, mainly due to the organ sounding synth work. As the track travels it's course things become heavier and far more psych. 'Trespasses Bay - Peaceful Place' is the longest and most complex of the tracks. It has again that wonderful twang guitar giving it a surf feel and, like the previous track, it does have a proggy feel at times but in the main it is a slowburning, psychedelic meander, chocked full of atmosphere and plenty of reverb. The last section has some great electronica that once again takes us back to the seventies.

The album is brought to a close by 'Mother Earth'...starting with some bucolic guitar that is bordering on folk, it is an initially pastoral track that shows another side to the band - a side that is not afraid to eschew their psychedelic musings for something more introspective and contemplative... for a while at least..it blossoms into a superlative jam as it nears the end of it's ten minute length. 'Adventures In The Upside Down' is a great album, full of invention and wonder - taking different aspects of the 'psych' world and mixing them to form an album that is actually remarkably restful and evocative. It is still as trippy as hell in places but, maybe more than their other recordings, more reliant on technique and craft rather than all out jamfests. It is, in short, a 'grown up' album.

Review from Dayzofpurpleandorange http://dayzofpurpleandorange.blogspot.com/2017/04/review-da-captain-trips-adventures-in.html

1.  The Calm And The Storm - 0:00
2.  Manta - 6:04
3.  Revelation - 11:01
4.  Dear Zahdia - 18:00
5.  Trepasses Bay - 23:48
6.  Peaceful Place - 28:48
7.  Mother Earth - 35:22

Title: Guest Mix: Arabic Tapes and Records with Habibi Funk
Description:
All music rights belong to their rightful owners. Please support the musicians and buy their music.
-----------
During these crazy times, we cannot spend time and interact with each other anymore. But this should not and will not stop us exploring and sharing the good music. Jannis from Habibi Funk played some awesome gems for us from his Berlin flat. I personally, -as a collector and music lover, am a huuuge fan of his label. I own almost all of the releases that they put out. Last week when he asked if he can make a guest mix for the channel, I was thrilled! In this mix, you will hear some legends like Ziad Rahbani and Ahmed Fakroun. And he's playing both tapes and records. Honestly, I enjoyed every second of it. I hope you will too.

Title: The Re-Stoned - Stories of the Astral Lizard Vol. 2 (Full Album 2022)
Description:
Stories of the Astral Lizard Vol. 2 (2022)
https://re-stoned.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/therestoned/
http://www.re-stoned.com/
THE RE-STONED ‚Äì is an instrumental power trio from Moscow, Russia, which is generally considered by many as a 'psychedelic stoner rock' underground act because of the band's remarkable heavily fuzzed guitar sound, that is empowered by confident old-school muscular riffing. 
====
1.
Spheres 00:00
2.
The Fourth Astral Projection    06:39
3.
Lucid Dream  15:14
4.
A Legend of Transparent Flowers    25:29
5.
Astral Realm   33:11
6.
Liquid Spores   40:53
7.
They Appear at Night    48:50
8.
Fluorescent Essence    01:01:05
9.
Gift of the Lizard     01:08:55
10.
Green Neon  01:12:11
11.
Where Does This Road Go     01:19:43
====
After almost 6 years passed we start feeling the same vibrations like saying ‚Äòisn‚Äôt it the right time to do such kind of jam again to see how much progress we made since then?‚Äô In February 2020 Evgeniy Tkachev finally made it to Moscow from distant Siberia with his good old djembe drum and we were lucky enough to record a lot of new material in 4 days. By the way it‚Äôs worth mentioning that the song ‚ÄúRusty Shuffle‚Äù was initially recorded for the album ‚ÄòStories of the Astral Lizard vol.2‚Äô but later was re-recorded with the full drum set and made it to the ‚ÄúThunders of the Deep‚Äù album. All guitar parts, mandolin, effects and even some bass parts I recorded myself, more complicated bass parts were recorded by our incredible bassist Vladimir Kislyakov. The unique flute and clarinet player Maxim Dobromyslov participated as a guest as well. I‚Äôm curious what would you say discovering a clarinet sound in The Re-Stoned? Anyway it was a great feeling of magic in the studio. Of course, our new album transmits different feelings and vibrations comparing to the Part 1.

In J.R.R.Tolkien‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Lord of the Rings‚Äô Gandalf says ‚ÄòA wizard is never late, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.‚Äô So, rephrasing the classic quote I can say that ‚ÄòThe Lizard is never late, nor is it early. It arrives precisely when it means to.‚Äô Which is the particular case with our new album. We promise to take you to another journey through the stories of the Astral Lizard, but are you ready to travel?

LP version released by Kozmik Artifactz
CD version released by Qiasum Music 
====
released May 20, 2022

Ilya Lipkin ‚Äì electric & acoustic guitars, fx, bass, mandolina
Evgeniy Tkachev (aka Rasputin) ‚Äì percussion, cymbals
Vladimir Kislyakov ‚Äì bass
Alexander Dobromyslov ‚Äì flute, clarinet

Recording at Rushus Studio 2020
Mixing by Ilya Lipkin, Mastering by Tobias Svensson & Janne Stark
Cover art by Alexander (Arzamas) Zhelonkin
Layout design by Ilya Lipkin, Photo by Anastasia Rodina (Rodinaatphoto)

Special thanks to Alexander (Arzamas) Zhelonkin, Alexander Dvoryankin, Andrey & Anna Goncharenko

Title: Electric Mountain - Valley Giant (Full Album 2022)
Description:
Order:https://www.electricvalleyrecords.com/category/electric-valley-records-releases (Vinyl)
https://evrecords.bandcamp.com/album/electric-mountain-valley-giant (Vinyl + Digital)
Emerged from Mexico City in 2013, Electric Mountain teems with the ‚Äò70s haze and the ‚Äò90s desert/stoner hardness. The power trio exults in fuzzy guitars, thunderous drums, and thick dirty bass lines, and seemingly, these aspects thunderingly dominated their 2017‚Äôs s/t debut album (originally released on CD by LSDR and later released on LP by Electric Valley Records). Notorious for being a very loud and energetic live act, the power trio has shared the stage with Elder and Blackwater Holylight, amongst several other bands. 
After a short hiatus, Electric Mountain returns with their second full-length, Valley Giant, with a more mature and intricate sound. On the new album, the Mexican heavy rocking crew sings new stories throughout nine burly structured songs surrounded by doomy and bluesy atmospheres. Despite staying a thousand miles high, Electric Mountain is determined to take over every stage they set foot on.

Title: Elektric Mistress - Chapter 99 (EP 2022)
Description:
Halifax, Nova Scotia‚Äôs Elektric Mistress has a new EP ‚ÄúChapter 99‚Äù coming out, which promises to be a sonic blast of psychedelic groove tinged with occult overtones and sludgy riffs. This will be their second EP, following their self-titled in 2019. Since then, they have added a new guitarist and a potent new layer of sounds for fans to discover. The first single they are releasing is the title track, a stomper that will get you moving and vibing to the lyrical themes of communing with the dead. The band explains further: 

‚ÄúChapter 99 was honestly not the first choice for this single; we had some trouble deciding just what to present, because we think they‚Äôre all pretty ok, heh. We decided to get an objective set of ears to sort out our predicament, and this one stood out above the rest. It‚Äôs about trying to connect with the other side. It has a definite occult overtone, in the oldest heavy music tradition.‚Äù 

Having a second guitarist has added to the complexity of the band, although their evolution has remained fairly steady over the past couple of years. They have started to incorporate guitar harmonies to complement their stoner rock style but still leave room to be unique and creative and resonate with listeners. Lyrics are inspired by events, people, memories, feelings, or certain energy. There are plenty of psychedelics, sci-fi, witchcraft, and apes! 

The EP ‚ÄúChapter 99‚Äù was entirely recorded and self-produced by the band, and all the stringed instruments and keys are digital. It was mixed and mastered by Alex Burris at Fang Recordings, and the EP artwork was done by Ricardo Arreola. 

Elektric Mistress is not out to reinvent the wheel, they deliver straightforward rock n‚Äô roll vibes for good times and bad. They are recommended listening for fans of Black Sabbath, Deep Purple, and Pink Floyd.
====
https://elektricmistress.bandcamp.com/
https://elektricmistress.com/
http://www.facebook.com/elektricmistress
https://www.instagram.com/elektricmistress
====
1. Magic Dust - 00:00
2. Radio -      04:06
3. Cocaine Johnny -   09:44
4. Chapter 99 -14:08
====
1. Magic Dust:
Pure stoner rock. Also, a tasty organ solo in the middle. It's about two people embarking on a romantic psychedelic trip together for the first time.  
2. Radio:
A song about how music or a song brings back memories of past relationships. Our most Black Sabbath-type riff, for sure. Riley came up with the main riff on this one.
3. Cocaine Johnny:
It's a fun and high energy song with some dark lyrics about addiction. Cocaine's a hell of a drug!  Purple worship, pure and simple. Just tuned a lot lower. This one was written by Maxwell pretty much entirely.
4. Chapter 99:
It's a great time! It's a party and everyone‚Äôs invited, even the dead!  People have been trying to connect the dead since the beginning of time, via seances, spells, and Oujia boards. A stomper for sure. Hopefully, it gets people moving.

Title: ùô≤ùöéùöóùöùùöõùöûùöñ "ùôµ√∂ùöõ ùôºùöéùöçùöíùöùùöäùöùùöíùöòùöó"
Description:
Centrum "F√∂r Meditation" 
Stoner Psychedelic spiritual drone 
Black vinyl

‚ÄúThe mantra that you‚Äôre given in Transcendental Meditation you keep to yourself. The reason being, true happiness is not out there, true happiness lies within‚Äù - so states David Lynch, a vocal proponent of this art on a twice-daily basis since 1973. It‚Äôs a maxim that holds true to Sweden‚Äôs Centrum, whose Rocket Recordings debut forms no less than a mysterious yet meaningful voyage into inner space.

Indeed, on ‚ÄòF√∂r Meditation‚Äô these sometime members of Hills and Weary Nous explore a soundworld that demonstrates all too adeptly that true heaviness of intent need not be the preserve of demonic riffs and highly cranked amps. Weaving a dense and beguiling tapestry of drone-based hypnosis, mantric vocal chants and ritualistic folk along with field recordings from a trip the members made to India, this band also inadvertently plots our a map from the experimental music of the early-‚Äò70s to the present, alighting on a myriad touchstones on the way.

Yet tempting through it may be to place ‚ÄòF√∂r Meditation‚Äô amidst the uniquely Swedish lineage of primal and arcadian Psychedelia that began with artists like Arbete Och Fritid, Tr√§d, Gras och Stenar and International Harvester, the band are keen to emphasise that inspiration arrives at Centrum from all quarters. ‚ÄúFrom Pandit Pran Nath to Trees, from Velvet Underground to Popol Vuh, anything and everything.

So lay down relax, turn off your phone and let Centrum
be your guide!

Description:
Uncle Acid and the Deadbeats "Bloodlust" 
Stoner Psychedelic Doom 
Gold Vinyl

A1 I'll cut you down 00:40
A2 Death's door 05:39
A3 Over and over again 12:55
A4 Curse in the trees 16:17
B1 I'm here to kill you 21:47
B2 13 Candles 25:27
B3 Ritual knife 32:25
B4 Withered hand of evil 37:10

Who are this mysterious cult phenomenon known as Uncle Acid & the Deadbeats? We are not able to shed much light on the identity of this drug-crazed coven of freaks but their addictive blend of heavy, melodic and garage horror-rock sounds have already taken the underground by storm.  The popularity of this anonymous bunch initially stemmed from people discovering tracks uploaded by them to Youtube, without any other hype. Two extremely limited self-financed mail order only Cd-r only albums were released (Vol 1 & Blood Lust) and interest in the band grew rapidly.

A vinyl edition of Blood Lust was released by Rise Above Records in 2011, which sold out instantly. Demand for this vinyl edition set the record collecting market on fire, with first pressing copies fetching up to ¬£700 on eBay. It was re-pressed on vinyl a second time earlier in 2012 and again sold out in minutes with the Rise Above Records website crashing under the strain of a staggering amount of hits.

All of this has happened without any live performances or clear photographs of the band ever being published. Whilst the electrifying quality of their music is unquestionable, their true identity still remains a mystery. All of this is about to change when they are finally unveiled for their hugely anticipated debut live performance in London, UK on March 22nd and 23rd. A second date has had to be added due to the high demand and the first night selling out in a very short space of time.

Having recently signed to Rise Above Records, they are due to enter the studio on Halloween 2012 to record their first full-length album for the label, which is due for a March 2013 release. In the meantime we are delighted to be giving the already legendary Blood Lust it‚Äôs first officially licensed release.
Blood Lust is music brings back the dark spirit of true rock and roll as conjured up by this anonymous cult of horror worshipping fiends. Uncle Acid has come to kill!

Title: East Mediterranean Grooves with Sven Wunder
Description:
All music rights belong to their rightful owners. Please support the musicians and buy their music.
#vinylmix #turkish #middleastern 

Wunder catapulted himself onto the global stage of contemporary grooves with his debut album Eastern Flowers (2019) followed by Wabi Sabi (2020) and Natura Morta (2021), released on his own label Piano Piano, which has appealed psych and prog listeners, folk or jazz aficionados and the hip hop connoisseurs with an open mind all around the world.

In this episode, Sven Wunder burrows into his collection with records recorded in the East Mediterranean countries during the 1970s that stretch between folk, jazz, funk and rock. From Nathan Davis take on ‚Äù√áe√ßen kƒ±zƒ±‚Äù to Ahmed Malek‚Äôs cinematic soundscapes on ‚ÄùAutopsie D'un Complot‚Äù, ‚ÄùNeveen‚Äù by Salah Ragab‚Äôs incredible Cairo Jazz Band and music by Nicolas Dick, Hamlet Minassian, Taroub, Selda and a much more.

------------

Title: Derya Yƒ±ldƒ±rƒ±m - live @ Club Gretchen | LIVING IN A BOX
Description:
Singer and multi-instrumentalist Derya Yƒ±ldƒ±rƒ±m learned piano, guitar, baƒülama, oud and saxophone from childhood. She constantly rearranges the rich traditional Turkish poetry and leads it into the future without losing the awareness of the past. Anatolian folk music combined with modern grooves, and hints of psychedelia, jazz and funk.

Derya Yƒ±ldƒ±rƒ±m - live @ Club Gretchen | 2020

A Deeper Kind of Slumber is the fifth studio album from Swedish band Tiamat. Featuring female background vocals by Birgit Zacher (Moonspell, Angel Dust) and experimentation with a variety of influences, the album marked the group's first complete withdrawal from both death metal and conventional heavy metal, following their 1994 release, Wildhoney. It was also the first production after their relocation to Germany, and was written almost entirely by founder/lead songwriter Johan Edlund. Much of the music had reflected on Edlund's personal relationship with drugs, creative differences within the band as well as an interpersonal relationship.

Title: PETH - Merchant of Death (Full Abum 2022)
Description:
Central Texas is well known for its underground heavy rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll from the late ‚Äò60s,‚Äô70s, and ‚Äò80s: ‚Äî a series of sounds different than any other place on earth have been originated and evolved from here time and time again. Fast forward some 50 years later and there are still the same hell-raisin, beer-drinking, guitar-slinging rock ‚Äòn‚Äô cowboys makin some noise in the Lone Star! Hence, it‚Äôs no surprise that in the 21st century, a band like PETH come along and start making some big ‚Äò70s Texas noise! 

Born in the middle of the 2020 pandemic, these four native Texans have been doin all the maniacal and lawless exploits with a wild mix of early ‚Äò70s proto-metal and heavy psych/occult rock soundscapes matched to that of early Black Sabbath, Scorpions, Medusa, Venom, Blue Cheer, Pentagram, ZZ Top, and the likes. Conjuring evil guitarmonies (what they call guitar harmonies), explosive trucking bass and drum section, and two knock-out vocalists, PETH truly help preserve the spirit of Texas‚Äôs old way of life while helping usher in this new era of rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll for generations to follow.

PETH‚Äôs debut LP, Merchant of Death, is a hidden gem of the ‚Äò70s/‚Äô80s metal invasion, but got discovered in the 21st century. The album in part brings menacing aggressions, in part brings breathtaking rhythms, but steers clear of the modern, lustrous sonic aesthetics. Roll out the red carpet for Merchant of Death and revel in the wilderness.

Title: Orchid: Through The Devil's Doorway EP
Description:
Through The Devil's Doorway EP
Stoner Doom Metal / San Francisco, CA
https://orchid.bandcamp.com/album/through-the-devils-doorway

I. Into The Sun 00:00
II. Eastern Woman 03:25
III. Son of Misery 07:47
IV. No One Makes a Sound 10:01

Into The Sun

Journey a thousand years deep in my mind
Transcending space to the dawn of all time
Dark shining backs break across desert sands
Nephilim‚Äôs children of Eve marching
Into the sun

Pyramids reaching up into the sky
God Marduk Ra lies in wait for the sign
Shadows move over, tell coming of one
On knees awaiting, our eyes turned up
Into the sun

Father of Adam shall come for his claim
Bringer of life and the giver of pain
Soon is upon us the day we are one
Children of false gods shall drive them back
Into the sun

Eastern Woman

Well she made me sit down with the doctor
To try to make sense of my mind
She never knew all the sense that the doctor would find
And I cried as I finally left her
And married a Dutch woman‚Äôs child
Tried as I might couldn‚Äôt live with the ways of the wild

Got myself an Eastern woman
Fires burning deep inside
Got myself an Eastern woman‚Äôs eye

So I read the Armenian‚Äôs letter
Said she came close to the end
I headed south never knowing what was to begin
And I know that I never can leave her
She found her way to my soul
Handed my heart to that girl of the night at the door

Son of Misery

Dark ships move onto the shore
Through the devil‚Äôs doorway
Pale men set upon this land
No mercy in their veins
Poison seeps unto the earth
Like some rain of hate

Call him man of God
Call him the son of misery
Call him lies and murder
Call him the son of misery

No One makes a Sound

Eagles of destruction they are rising
Father can you hear your sons are dying
Screaming faces make no sound
Safely seen from off the ground
Fires in the crescent moon keep burning

And they ain‚Äôt gonna listen
Until no one makes a sound

Iron tigers rolling through the darkness
Crushing hopes and dreams under their cold, relentless wheels
Screaming faces make no sound
Safely seen from off the ground
Fires in the crescent moon keep burning

And they ain‚Äôt gonna listen
Until no one makes a sound

TV eye is always watching
Tells us what to feel
Another world their little lives seem anything but real
TV man says it‚Äôs ok, don‚Äôt worry ‚Äòbout a thing
TV eye is always watching
You don‚Äôt have to think

And they ain‚Äôt gonna listen
Until no one makes a sound

Title: Orchid: Capricorn
Description:
Capricorn 2011 The Church Within Records
Stoner Doom Metal (San Francisco, CA)
https://orchid.bandcamp.com/album/capricorn
Through The Devil's Doorway EP: https://youtu.be/O2kPcSouoEo
The Mouths of Madness: https://youtu.be/MKCTG0_m9A4

I. Eyes Behind The Wall 00:00
II. Capricorn 07:14
III. Black Funeral 11:55
IV. Masters of it All 18:23
V. Down into The Earth 25:00
VI. He Who Walks Alone 31:25
VII. Cosmonaut of Three 38:14
VIII. Electric Father 43:58
IX. Albatross 51:19

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Capricorn

It‚Äôs the nature of existence, the circling of time
A man within his castle sings the songs within his mind
A thousand winking magic stars
A thousand tales to tell
Commanding them with quickness
Sits the wizard in his shell

You move these feelings from the mind into the soul
You guide the madness from the blind
Oh Capricorn

The meeting of the madness
Machines reflecting love
Spiraling in colors down from something held above
The memories of children lost
Their kings they froze in stone
These fools of re-connection try
To sit upon their throne

You move these feelings from the heart into the soul
You guide the madness from the blind
Oh Capricorn 

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Black Funeral

Sitting on borrowed time, yes it‚Äôs true
Man in the highest chair says you‚Äôre through
Clock on the wall ticks screaming in your mind
Devils stand waiting, laughing, you‚Äôve arrived

Slipping into the grey, stealing your breath away
Hourglass out of sand, feeling the cold dark hand
Black funeral

Feeling your body fading from your mind
Falling in darkness leaving your life behind
Now is the time you answer for your ways
Living eternal darkness for all days

Slipping into the grey, stealing your breath away
Hourglass out of sand, feeling the cold dark hand
Black funeral

As your last breath slips into the future
Is it true?
What they said about the prophecies pretending
That they knew
Your energy is slowly slipping
Hands are gripping round your eyes
Who knows where you‚Äôll go when you are ending
Ending all your time
Black funeral

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Cosmonaut of Three

I fall through space and time
Motion I cannot slow
Astral projection through worlds that I have not known
Facing my true self at last I‚Äôm locked in my mind
Drowning in visions released in circular time

My eyes wide open, for the first time
The light is falling through the trees
The faces smile at me, colors surround
I am the cosmonaut of three

Three is the number who have chosen this night
To step through the doorway
Embracing portals of sight
We cannot know where this strange journey will end
Ingesting cybin our bodies slowly transcend

Twisting and turning
Night turns to day
Facing my true self once again
I am the jury
Judgment to hang
Riding the darkness to the end

My eyes wide open, for the first time
The light is falling through the trees
The faces smile at me, colors surround
I am the cosmonaut of three

‚ò© ‚ò© ‚ò©

Electric Father

No one knows what lies within your brain
Son of greed, construct of worlds of insane
Wires vibrate heartless thoughts that tell you what to do
Watching every moment of the game

It seems those who pray to you are sightless
It seems those who worship you see nothing of your plan

Electric Father
Watching from the sky
Floating in the silence as our freedom slowly dies
Electric Father
Cold collecting eye
Will you still be watching when we‚Äôre through?
Watching when there‚Äôs nothing left to do

High above your sleepless shadow turns
Synthetic super nova‚Äôs fires burn
Secret lives of twisted men
Who tell you what to do
Child of paranoia slowly learns

It seems those who pray to you are sightless
It seems those who worship you see nothing of your plan

Electric Father
Watching from the sky
Floating in the silence as our freedom slowly dies
Electric Father
Cold collecting eye
Will you still be watching when we‚Äôre through?
Watching when there‚Äôs nothing left to do

You watch with super sonic sight
Your eyes see everywhere
There are no secrets in our lives
Cannot escape your stare
Collecting, detecting
No love within your heart
The bastard son of paranoia
The watcher in the dark

Father
Hears my words
Spinning and counting
Watch everything that I do

Father
Hears my words
Silently listening
Waiting to tell about you

Title: NUMA - Tranquillitas (Album Mix) [Folktronica / Downtempo]
Description:
üåé Links: https://bio.shivelight.art
üëï Merch: https://shop.shivelight.art
üåü Join: https://youtube.com/shivelight/join

‚ãò ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚àó ‚ãÖ‚óà‚ãÖ ‚àó ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ãô

Presenting the full album mix of NUMA's "Tranquillitas" shamanic downtempo compilation, released in winter last year. 

"The winter solstice marks a very special and spiritually important time of the year. Nature itself is asking us all to become more silent... to slow down... to rest. Animals go into hibernation and we as humans enjoy the sheltered comfort of our homes with a hot tea and a warm blanket.Winter is a time of darkness. The winter solstice marks the time where the days get shorter and the nights become longer. So there will be less light outside which in turn invites us to seek and find more light within. This time allows us to go deep within and to reflect upon the past and also connect with dreams and visions for the year to come. It's a great time for meditation and prayer to let go and relax.

Tranquillitas was the goddess and personification of tranquillity, security and peace, and it can be translated into calmness, peacefulness and a state of security and ease.

To support you in this process of introspection and meditation we have invited old and new friends to share their unique approach on this idea. Weather you just want to sit and listen, meditate, do your yoga practice, need a soundtrack for your ceremony or are looking for some intimate and deep moments in your ecstatic dance sets this compilation will be at your service. Each track is soulfully composed and invites the listener to gently open the heart and to connect with the inner emotional landscapes to find guidance and wisdom within."

Stream / Download: http://33r.pm/OYvM

https://www.instagram.com/pacayart/

Description:

I. On the Mountain 00:00

ON THE MOUNTAIN

What do you see that lies ahead of you
Listen to the forest and you‚Äôll hear the echoes call
Following the trail you are bound to feel tall
Do you understand where we'll all be going to

On the mountain we shall survive
On the mountain conquest we'll find

Travelling this land there are many paths to take
Feel it in your heart an there will be no mistake
Blazing a trail there is fire in your eyes
Looking to the distance you can see the eagle soar

On the mountain we shall survive
On the mountain conquest we'll find

Climbing ever higher there is magic in the air
The wind is blowing hard as it flows through your hair
The final resting place is straight ahead of you
You‚Äôre on the mountain and you‚Äôve done all you could do

On the mountain we shall survive
On the mountain conquest we'll find

GENERATION VOID

Where have we gone yesterday
Where will we be tomorrow
What lies straight ahead of us
Just cut the cards and place your bet

Skyscrapers standing all so tall
In a short time they all will fall
Enter a brand new universe
Overwhelmed by the new technology

Feel the thunder, shake the ground
Buildings are crumbling, just take a good look around
See the fire, in the sky, that's when it‚Äôs over, now it's
Your time to die
Look to the oceans, see them rising
A wall of waves will keep washing the filth away

Take my hand my children, and walk with me
Your life has just begun, oh can't you see
He'll lead us on, living for another day

Title: Freedom Hawk - Take All You Can (Full Album 2022)
Description:
Digital or Physical copies available at https://ripplemusic.bandcamp.com/music
Physical copies available at https://ripplemusic.bigcartel.com/
The champions of the East Coast underground are back in top form with their sixth-full length this fall! Following the success of their 2018 Ripple Music debut, 'Beast Remains', FREEDOM HAWK have made the most of the pandemic by channeling all their creative energy into setting up their own recording and rehearsal space and writing this 9-track record. Armed with confidence, the foursome delivers their strongest and most heartfelt effort, brimming with the vibe and energy of a relaxed band in a comfortable setting pouring their hearts out in every beat and note.

About the new album, the band says: 
"The world was and is in the need of love and the lyrics on this album convey this thought in a dark way. ‚ÄúTake All You Can‚Äù really expands into newer territory of tasty bluesy melodies, driving 
harmonies, and killer song structures that have hooks for days‚Ä¶ We feel like it is our best stuff to date and we can't wait for people to hear it worldwide!"

Check out the music video for the first single, "Age of the Idiot" @ https://youtu.be/zqi-Z1dW2w8
And the fantastic video for the title track and third single, "Take All You Can" @ https://youtu.be/QOosde75DGM

Title: Eritrean Jazz, Soul & Traditional Grooves with Nahom from Eritrean Anthology
Description:
All music rights belong to their rightful owners. Please support the musicians and buy their music.
#vinylmix #eritrea  

Eritrean Anthology started out as a side project during the early days of Covid, with the primary objective to raise awareness over social media about¬†the existence of Eritrean 45s from 1970-75, often overlooked or unknown of their existence. The project gathered momentum over the last 2 years, whilst in parallel my pursuit to collect as many records as I could possibly find gradually started to bear fruit, and has since enabled me to showcase these forgotten treasures to a community of curious listeners as well as those that connect¬†to it culturally.

"The first record on the list is Halhalta Fichrichi, a soul-jazz influenced record performed by the legendary Zerai Deres Band and fronted by their lead singer, Haile Ghebru.¬†I have made it a habit of mine to start my Eritrean sets with this record, as a tribute to a deceased family member¬†whom at one time this record belonged to. It is probably the only Eritrean 45 I own that hasn't been previously owned by more than one person.

The vinyl era in Eritrea was short lived, spanning merely over 5 years, producing no more than 75 singles with limited copies in distribution making these records a collectors item no doubt, but more worryingly an era in Eritrean music history that may be at risk of being forgotten if not documented or celebrated.

I finished the set with one of the handful of Eritrean music inspired LPs produced in the diaspora, by German krautrock band, Dambisa, who features Eritrean vocalist Jamal M. Jassin. The track you hear is Asmarena, a cover originally written and performed by Osman Abdulrahim, the same artist who features twice during this set."
------------
Our Silver and Gold Tier supporters get uninterrupted, uncut, ad-free, high-quality audio of all mixes.
To support this channel, you can visit our Patreon page and make a small donation!
https://www.patreon.com/myanalogjournal
------------
Massive shout-out to all of our Patreon supporters. 
Special thanks to Kazenoir, NathanK, Mike Schneider, Mike Marrotte, Raylex13, Thaddius Moody, Manuel Najera, Khalifa Al Baloushi, Clay Lorant, Eggert Kristjansson, Paul Yula, Bem and Marshall C Brown

Title: Lotus Emperor - Syneidesis (Full Album 2022)
Description:
Syneidesis (2022)
7 years after their self-titled debut, and a minor classic among the international heavy-psych scene, Lotus Emperor are back with ‚ÄúSyneidesis‚Äù, their second and debut for Sound Effect Records! Led by Constantina Latzaki‚Äôs voice, Lotus Emperor have broaden their horizons, moving on to a mystical journey, an atmospheric mixture of fuzzed-out doom, shoegaze and post-punk, all part of a deeply ritualistic psychedelic concept! On ‚ÄúSyneidesis‚Äù Lotus Emperor go cinematic and turn the ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù sophomore album to their most compelling work so far.
https://lotusemperor.bandcamp.com/album/syneidesis
https://www.facebook.com/LotusEmperor
https://www.instagram.com/lotus_emperor/
lotus emperor
Athens, Greece
====
Released on limited black and neon violet vinyl and CD, on November 25th 2022.
Sound Effect Records
https://www.soundeffect-records.gr/
https://www.facebook.com/SoundEffectRecords
====
We open our sails for a second time! With aid from "Anemos" (Wind,) Lotus Emperor‚Äôs vessel travels again through the mysteries of life, using our sounds as a medium to carve the "Petra"(Stone) and, through our ‚Äú#59‚Äù  wormhole accelerator, shape the new collective "Syneidesis" (Consciousness) in order to get things done from the beginning to the ‚ÄúSynteleia‚Äù (The End).
====

Title: Mister Earthbound - Shadow Work (Full Album 2022)
Description:
Shadow Work (2022)
http://misterearthbound.bandcamp.com/
https://www.facebook.com/MisterEarthbound/
https://www.instagram.com/misterearthbound/
A Swamp Rock N' Roll quartet out of Richmond, Virginia, MISTER EARTHBOUND blends the psychedelic tones of the 13TH FLOOR ELEVATORS and the raucous early days of PENTAGRAM with the eerie blues of SCREAMING JAY HAWKINS. 
====
1.
Not To Know 00:00
2.
So Many Ways   06:24
3.
Coffin Callin'   11:44
4.
Hot Foot Powder   17:23
5.
Wicked John  23:19
6.
Weighed    27:07
7.
No Telling   33:31
====
The debut album from Mister Earthbound is a sonic exploration of the darker side of self. Their searing riffs, haunting vocals, and driving rhythms will drag you under to explore the swampy depths of your own mind.

released November 15, 2022

All music by Mister Earthbound
Recorded, Mixed, Mastered at The Funhouse
Richmond, VA

Leif Edling on the new album: 
‚ÄúSweet Evil Sun is about hope, striving, adoration and failure. It's about all the personal battles that you have, but also the never-ending decay of humanity.
The record took over a year to make and there's not a bad track on it! We had a fantastic time recording it and are really looking forward to the release. It's Doom, It's Metal! It is the essence of CANDLEMASS put into one album!‚Äù

Title: L'Imp√©ratrice at the Grand Palais, Paris - Passengers - ARTE Concert
Description:
#TAKOTSUBO #LIMPERATRICE 

[AVAILABLE UNTIL 26/03/2026]

Passengers a toujours eu le chic pour d√©nicher des lieux incroyables. Pour ce nouveau num√©ro, la barre est mise encore tr√®s haut : c‚Äôest sous la nef du Grand Palais que nous recevons @limperatrice_. Charles de Boisseguin, Flore Benguigui et leurs acolytes y d√©ploient une session de toute beaut√© associant leurs tubes √† des nouveaut√©s extraites de leur nouvel album¬†: Tako Tsubo.

M√©lop√©es r√™veuses, orchestration √©th√©r√©e et vibrations retro¬†: L'Imp√©ratrice¬†invite √† l'indolence et √† une insouciance g√©n√©ralis√©es. Ses arguments ? Une douce voix f√©minine et des sonorit√©s vintage √† souhait qui ravivent l'√¢ge d'or de la French Touch, Daft Punk et Air en t√™te. Entre funk, space disco, revival 90's et influences tiki, la musique de L'Imp√©ratrice sonne famili√®re tout en √©tant d'une grande fra√Æcheur.Apr√®s le succ√®s de l‚Äôalbum Matahari (2018), L‚ÄôImp√©ratrice se rappelle √† notre bon souvenir avec un tout nouvel album baptis√© Tako Tsubo. Introduit par de nombreux singles ‚Äì dont le tr√®s remarqu√© ¬´¬†La Peur des filles¬†¬ª - ce deuxi√®me opus permet au groupe de montrer un visage plus √©clectique mais toujours aussi dansant. Le changement dans la continuit√© en somme.

En plus de la musique de L‚ÄôImp√©ratrice, ce Passengers permet de se p√¢mer devant la beaut√© de la nef du Grand Palais. Ce bijou de la Belle Epoque amor√ßant tout juste une mue devant durer plusieurs ann√©es, ce serait b√™te de s‚Äôen priver.

Concert enregistr√© le 24 f√©vrier 2021 au Grand Palais, Paris.

FAQ:

1. Can I use this in my video/stream/film/game/project/podcast etc.?
- Yes, my music is 100% copyright free so you can use it in ANY creative project, just credit me "music by Karl Casey @ White Bat Audio". What you CANNOT do is take my music and redistribute it as a product.

2. How do I credit you?
- "Music by Karl Casey @ White Bat Audio" is fine. You can put the song title too if you like.


3. Can I record vocals on your music and upload to Spotify, Apple Music etc.?
- No.


4. Can I use your music in videos/projects that are monetized?
- Yes.


5. Why did I get a copyright claim when using your music?
- It is either something else in your video, FB or Twitch being stupid and overly sensitive with their copyright detection software, or someone is making a fraudulent copyright claim on my music. Simply dispute the claim as you have full permission from me to use my music! - You must credit me in the video description when using my music on YouTube. -  If you receive a copyright claim when using my music on YouTube and you are sure you've credited me correctly in the video description, you can simply fill out this form and the claim will be dealt with very quickly: https://forms.gle/X5QvKPN1YEx7eiKV7 - Once you've filled out the above form, you can dispute the claim on YouTube and it will be dropped.

"Make your Dream be a Beautiful One"

You will still be in it for this time you chose, and Now you realize what's your roll in it.
